comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:6.0a1)
Gecko/20110420 Firefox/6.0a1


New Mac Wireless keyboard dont have "Home", "End", "Page up", "Page Down", "Insert", "Delete" keys.
http://www.apple.com/keyboard/


For "Home" key, "command + left arrow" is used 
and for "End" key, "command + right arrow" is used.
But this cause an issue with firefox "Back/Forward" history actions.

On TEXTAREA and INPUT form controls this is not an issue, it works fine. 
But on "Design Mode" editor area this is an issue.

Steps:-
Phase I
1. On a Mac with new wireless mac keyboard start Firefox
2. Open a new tab 
3. Goto http://www-archive.mozilla.org/editor/midasdemo/
4. Type "twinkle twinkle little star"
5. Press command + left arrow
6. See cursor goes to beginning of the line
7. Press command + right arrow
8. See cursor goes to end of the line

Phase II

9. On same tab go to http://www.google.com/
10. Then goto http://www-archive.mozilla.org/editor/midasdemo/
11. Again goto http://www.google.com/
12. Press Back button to come back to Midas Demo page
13. Type "twinkle twinkle little star"
14. Press command + left arrow

Expected:-
Should be equivalent to "Home Key"

Result:-
The history switched one step back

Similarly, command + right arrow should act like "End" Key
